caption: Figure 1: Representative samples generated by END on QM9 (top), and GEOM-DRUGS (bottom).
description: This figure shows example molecules generated by the Equivariant Neural Diffusion (END) model.  The top row displays smaller molecules from the QM9 dataset, while the bottom row shows larger, more complex molecules from the GEOM-Drugs dataset. The figure visually demonstrates the model's ability to generate diverse and chemically plausible molecules of varying sizes and complexities.

caption: Figure 1: Representative samples generated by END on QM9 (top), and GEOM-DRUGS (bottom).
description: This figure shows example molecules generated by the Equivariant Neural Diffusion (END) model.  The top row displays examples from the QM9 dataset, which contains smaller organic molecules. The bottom row showcases examples from the GEOM-DRUGS dataset, featuring larger and more complex drug-like molecules.  The figure visually demonstrates the model's ability to generate diverse and chemically plausible molecules across different sizes and complexities.
